str2: However, nevertheless, but, except that, yet. From pleion; moreover, i.e. Albeit, save that, rather, yet.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To give solemn evidence, testify (declare) solemnly. From dia and martureo; to attest or protest earnestly, or hortatively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Or desmos des-mos' neuter and masculine respectively from deo; a band, i.e. Ligament or shackle; figuratively, an impediment or disability.
Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
